Title.En: Summer School ‘’Teaching TUL – Immersive Summer School’’

Description.En: This micro-module is based on the idea of developing solutions for the European Diploma  and Flexible Learning Pathways in an international environment during the summer school hosted in Poland. Paricipants, ECIU teachers,  will carry out in-depth teamwork in one of those topics. They will learn how to identify the challenge, obtain, and compile reaserch information and communicate the results in English on minimum CEFR B2+ level. The participants will be able to gain valuable creative problem-solving skills. This challenge is a chance to make a tangible difference in how we approach lifelong learning within the ECIU capacity. We invite teachers who are ready to create a meaningful change by benefiting not only themselves through skill acquisition, but also by making a valuable impact on the ECIU community.

NoteLiteral.En: Participants will be able to analyze complex problems and propose solutions using the CBL life cycle
Participants will be able to demonstrate creativity in combining skills and knowledge from different fields
Participants will be able to effectively communicate project results to various audiences using at least CEFR B2 level English
Participants will be able to formulate knowledge-based arguments, present and evaluate different opinions and positions, and discuss them

Title.En: Summer School ‘’Teaching TUL – Immersive Summer School’’
Summer School ‘’Teaching TUL – Immersive Summer School’’

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral: This is a face-to-face summer school. The estimated overall learning time is 40 hours.
Find solutions for the European Diploma and Flexible Learning Pathways development.

Does the idea of universities across Europe offering standardized modules that can be transferred and recognized at different institutions sound appealing? Does the concept of actively engaging learners in designing their own educational paths based on their interests and career goals seem intriguing? We invite you to take on the challenge and participate in the Summer School on the European Diploma and Flexible Learning Paths.
•	Imagine a European Diploma that influences learners' interdisciplinary educational experience, is aligned with the labor market, and is awarded with full respect for institutional autonomy and academic freedom. Imagine a university wanting to develop a new program with a foreign partner in a specific field. 
The goal is to create solutions that could significantly contribute to the implementation of the European Diploma in response to social needs, adapted to the changing market demands, while maintaining high academic standards.
•	Imagine a student-centered educational model that opens doors to various educational choices and enables learners to create educational paths based on their needs, aspirations, preferences, background, (prior) knowledge, and abilities. Imagine a flexible learning path that helps learners progress to higher education levels and the job market, acquire new practical skills, and achieve better outcomes. 
The goal is to develop solutions that could significantly contribute to the implementation of the ECIU Flexible Learning Paths model.

This micro-module is open to all ECIU academic teachers.  You are kindly asked to register by 30.07.2024. Please note that participant selection is based on ‘’the first come, first served’’ basis and on the completion of the microsoft form that will be received by you from the TUL international officer.
